paper_abstract: We give an acount of the basic determinants of the courses of computation of the Infinite Time Turing Machine model of Hamkins and Kidder, a model of computation which allows for transfinitely many steps of computation, and therefore may accept and output infinite strings of bits. We provide, inter alia, a Normal form Theorem, and a characterisation of which ordinals start gaps in halting times of such machines. (C) 2008 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Characteristics of discrete transfinite time Turing machine models: Halting times, stabilization times, and Normal Form theorems
